title: React
text: React is a library for building user interfaces that allows you to write in a declarative style.

title: Components + JSX
text: A component is a function that returns markup. JSX is a JavaScript syntax extension that lets you write HTML inside JavaScript

title: Reusable Component + Props
text: Props are a way to pass data from a parent to a component.

title: Map
text: The way to render a list of items in React, is to use the map function with specified keys

title: useState
text: Hook that allows a component to remember data between rerenders.

title: Controlled components
text: Controlled components are fields whose value is managed entirely by state (useState).

title: Function call via props
text: In JSX you can't pass a function call - only a reference or a wrapper (arrow function)

title: useEffect
text: The effect will be called every time the state or variable changes
